segments.text: I see the water overflowing from the sink, spilling onto the floor and creating a puddle.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is just standing there, drying dishes, completely unaware of the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a sense of disgust, seeing the water just going to waste like that.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are being so sneaky, taking cookies right behind her back.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is standing on a wobbly stool, reaching for the cookie jar, and it's just gross to see him risking his safety for a treat.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is waiting patiently for her cookie, her hand outstretched, and it's just disgusting to see them being so deceitful.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if they've done this before, sneaking cookies while the woman is distracted.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful and calm, a stark contrast to the disgusting scene inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I need to say something, but I don't want to disturb the scene and make it even more disgusting.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't believe the woman hasn't noticed any of this yet, it's just disgusting to see her so unaware.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope everything turns out okay, but I can't shake this feeling of disgust.
segments.speaker: PAR
